revised_title: Model-Independent Aspects of Tracer Chromatography Theory
tldr: The article presents a model-independent theory of tracer chromatography based on population balances in the steady state. It shows that the mean residence time for a substance is the ratio of the steady-state holdup to its rate of steady transmission through the system. This theory provides a more precise basis for interpreting chromatographic data and reveals that the assumptions in existing models are often unduly limiting.
